updates.title: home work 2 Update
updates.description: Please note that the project document has been updated towards Milestone 2. Tip: To learn how to work with vector, map, iterator, auto or for_each. It is recommended to practice this with a separate toy code before assimilating into the project. Also, pay attention to how the parameters, income or output is transferred from a data structure.

courses.description: The purpose of the Advanced Programming course (1,2) is to prepare you for the industry. In particular, the course is structured so that at the end of Advanced Programming 1 you can start looking for a job in a serious way, and you will have the first part of the project with the help of which you can demonstrate to the employer your experience and abilities.

courses.description: In recent years there has been a major breakthrough in the field of artificial neural networks, especially in deep neural networks (namely, networks with many layers). Deep learning is the term coined for the training of such networks, which have shown superiority over other machine learning algorithms in many applications. Nowadays, deep neural networks provide the best performance in tasks such as, voice recognition, object detection, image classification and content suggestion. These networks gradually take over standard machine learning algorithms and we are at the heart of a new generation, where voice recognition and image recognition are based on them fully. In this course we will explain the mathematics at the core of neural networks models, and provide practical tools for using them. The course focuses mainly on image processing and, consequently, on convolutional neural networks.

Lession 7 (b): Anomaly Detection in Time Series - more methods
Lession 8 (a): Unsupervised Anomaly Detection on TimeSeries

Lession 10 (b): An Ensemble Deep Learning-Based Cyber-Attack Detection in Industrial Control System
Lession 11 (a): Internet of Things Cyber Attacks Detection using Machine Learning
Lession 11 (b): DDoS Attack Detection using Machine Learning Techniques in Cloud Computing Environments
Lession 12 (a): From product recommendation to cyber-attack prediction: generating attack graphs and predicting future attacks
Lession 12 (b): A Machine-Learning-Based Cyber Attack Detection Model for Wireless Sensor Networks in Microgrids

courses.description: The course will consist of 4 main parts. 1) Encryption and how to crack it, from a computational point of view: Theoretical encryption and how to crack encryptions using heuristic algorithms. 2) Graph theory for communication networks: general introduction, cyber-attacks with graphs, detecting signals in time and creating a secure network, computationally detecting communication networks. 3) Anomaly detection from the point of view of a cyber defender: The theory of anomalies with examples from the industry on several use-cases. 4) Machine learning to perform and detect cyber-attacks: An introduction to machine learning in the context of cyber security, using machine learning to study an attack on an organization's network, using machine learning to detect a non-aggressive DDOS attack.

courses.name: Reinforcement Leanring
courses.description: The quest to fully realize the potential of Artificial Intelligence (AI), requires autonomous systems that can learn to make good decisions by interacting with their environment. Reinforcement learning is a paradigm that meets these requirements, and can be applied to various tasks, including game-playing, healthcare, economics, and robotics. This course gives a solid introduction to reinforcement learning with its core approaches and challenges, and is structured around several lectures, assignments, and a project.
